Haiti judge charges widow, ex-PM over president's assassinationA Haitian judge in charge the investigation into the 2021 assassination of the Caribbean nation's last president has charged some fifty people, including his widow and a former prime minister, according to a document leaked to local media. Tue, 20 Feb 2024 00:30:14 GMT BDL7E3YK6FMXJIHHUWAJAZBVOU https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/haiti-judge-charges-widow-ex-pm-over-presidents-assassination-2024-02-20/Reuters世界美洲
China ready to work with EU to uphold free trade, multilateralism, foreign minister saysChina is ready to work with the European Union to uphold free trade, practice multilateralism, and promote an equal and orderly multi-polar world and inclusive economic globalisation, its foreign minister said during a visit to Spain. Tue, 20 Feb 2024 00:12:52 GMT DOG54DL2EFJSHJLIFVWMSOXCDQ https://www.reuters.com/world/china-ready-work-with-eu-uphold-free-trade-multilingualism-foreign-minister-says-2024-02-20/Reuters世界
Explainer: Who is Julian Assange?WikiLeaks' founder Julian Assange will launch on Tuesday what could be his last chance in an English court to stop his extradition to the United States to face criminal charges including one under the espionage act. Tue, 20 Feb 2024 00:09:02 GMT 25QXIX4JLNIHFKWSJFHDUPO3TI https://www.reuters.com/world/who-is-julian-assange-2024-02-20/Reuters世界
UK's Prince William to recognise Middle East suffering, office saysBritain's Prince William will carry out a number of engagements to "recognise the human suffering" caused by the conflict in Gaza and the Middle East and to draw attention to the global rise in antisemitism, his office said on Tuesday. Tue, 20 Feb 2024 00:04:56 GMT CPHXMDINWNOH5CXCUM64N2ID3M https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/uks-prince-william-recognise-middle-east-suffering-office-says-2024-02-20/Reuters世界英国
WikiLeaks' Assange in last-ditch battle to stop U.S. extraditionWikiLeaks founder Julian Assange begins what could be his last chance to stop his extradition from Britain to the United States on Tuesday after more than 13 years battling the authorities in the English courts. Tue, 20 Feb 2024 00:03:11 GMT OA6I245RLJLEFMXUKUKSSCK4GU https://www.reuters.com/world/wikileaks-assange-last-ditch-battle-stop-us-extradition-2024-02-20/Sam Tobin, Michael Holden世界
El Salvador opposition requests repeat election for congress after irregularities in vote countOpposition parties in El Salvador on Monday asked the country's election authority to void the results of congressional elections that took place in early February and re-do the vote after a hand count of ballots revealed several irregularities. Mon, 19 Feb 2024 23:58:05 GMT ESMYFSLEJVVBD4GD5J2LTLDJ4 https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/el-salvador-opposition-requests-repeat-election-congress-after-irregularities-2024-02-19/Reuters世界美洲
Australia to invest additional A$11.1 bln over next decade in defenceAustralia said on Tuesday it would inject an additional A$11.1 billion ($7.25 billion) over the next decade in defence for the accelerated delivery of the navy's future surface combatant fleet and to expand the country's shipbuilding industry. Mon, 19 Feb 2024 23:53:25 GMT NLKEOT6ETBITDLBD2WI7AASH5Y https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/australia-invest-additional-a111-bln-over-next-decade-defence-2024-02-19/Reuters世界亚太地区
Ukraine's Zelenskiy decries 'mockery' of Polish border protestsUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Monday decried as a "mockery" protests by Polish farmers that have disrupted passenger and freight traffic in and out of Ukraine and called for "rational decisions" to restore normal cross-border traffic. Mon, 19 Feb 2024 23:30:39 GMT 32HY6QSFUNM3VPIXLCNMFQMCPM https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraines-zelenskiy-decries-mockery-polish-border-protests-2024-02-19/Reuters世界欧洲
Vessel damaged in drone attack north of Djibouti, says UK agencyA vessel sustained "superficial damage" after being hit by a drone in the Red Sea, 60 nautical miles north of Djibouti, the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO) agency said on Monday. Mon, 19 Feb 2024 23:22:39 GMT SMWKEAYQHRKHNIOELMMYU73WLA https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/vessel-damaging-drone-attack-north-djibouti-says-uk-agency-2024-02-19/Reuters世界中东
North Korea's Kim Jong Un receives car as gift from Putin - KCNANorth Korean leader Kim Jong Un has received a car from Russia's President Vladimir Putin as a gift "for his personal use," official media reported on Tuesday, in what could be a violation of U.N. ban that Moscow had joined to adopt against Pyongyang. Mon, 19 Feb 2024 22:23:16 GMT MDTYWWBJVVLFRJJRPXGQ6KGIUE https://www.reuters.com/world/north-koreas-kim-jong-un-receives-car-gift-putin-kcna-2024-02-19/Jack Kim世界
Lockbit cybercrime gang disrupted by Britain, US and EULockbit, a notorious cybercrime gang that holds its victims' data to ransom, has been disrupted in a rare international law enforcement operation by Britain’s National Crime Agency, the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation, Europol and a coalition of international police agencies, according to a post on the gang’s extortion website on Monday. Mon, 19 Feb 2024 21:23:19 GMT EBCDJOZVXJJCRM2KVF4UXI5PZM https://www.reuters.com/technology/cybersecurity/lockbit-cybercrime-gang-disrupted-by-international-police-operation-2024-02-19/James Pearson技术网络安全
